pageProps.body:
Simple Linear Factors

Suppose f(x)=p(x)q(x)f(x)=\frac{p(x)}{q(x)}f(x)=q(x)p(x)​, where ppp and qqq are polynomials with no common factors and with the degree of ppp less than the degree of qqq.

Step 1

Factor the denominator qqq in the form (x−r1)(x−r2)⋯(x−rn)(x-r_1)(x-r_2)\cdots(x-r_n)(x−r1​)(x−r2​)⋯(x−rn​), where r1,⋯ ,rnr_1,\cdots,r_nr1​,⋯,rn​ are distinct real numbers.

Step 2

Form the partial fraction decomposition by writing

p(x)q(x)=A1(x−r1)+A2(x−r2)+⋯+An(x−rn)\frac{p(x)}{q(x)}=\frac{A_1}{(x-r_1)}+\frac{A_2}{(x-r_2)}+\cdots+\frac{A_n}{(x-r_n)}q(x)p(x)​=(x−r1​)A1​​+(x−r2​)A2​​+⋯+(x−rn​)An​​

Step 3

Clear denominators by multiplying both sides of the equation in Step 2 by q(x)=(x−r1)(x−r2)⋯(x−rn)q(x)=(x-r_1)(x-r_2)\cdots(x-r_n)q(x)=(x−r1​)(x−r2​)⋯(x−rn​), which produces conditions for A1,⋯ ,AnA_1,\cdots,A_nA1​,⋯,An​.

Step 4

Solve for coefficients by equating like powers of xxx in Step 3 to solve for the undetermined coefficients A1,⋯ ,AnA_1,\cdots,A_nA1​,⋯,An​.

Example

  1. Find the partial fraction decomposition for f(x)=3x2+6x−2x3−x2−2xf(x)=\frac{3x^2+6x-2}{x^3-x^2-2x}f(x)=x3−x2−2x3x2+6x−2​.

  2. Evaluate ∫f(x) dx\int{f(x)}\,dx∫f(x)dx.

Solution

The partial fraction decomposition is done in five steps...

  • Factor the denominator
    x3−x2−2x=x(x+1)(x−2)x^3-x^2-2x=x(x+1)(x-2)x3−x2−2x=x(x+1)(x−2)
  • Write the partial fraction decomposition
    3x2+6x−2x3−x2−2x=Ax+Bx+1+Cx−2\frac{3x^2+6x-2}{x^3-x^2-2x}=\frac{A}{x}+\frac{B}{x+1}+\frac{C}{x-2}x3−x2−2x3x2+6x−2​=xA​+x+1B​+x−2C​
    (The goal is to find the undetermined coefficients AAA, BBB, and CCC.)
  • Multiply both sides of the equation by x(x+1)(x−2)x(x+1)(x-2)x(x+1)(x−2)
(Ax+Bx+1+Cx−2)((x)(x+1)(x−2))(\frac{A}{x}+\frac{B}{x+1}+\frac{C}{x-2})((x)(x+1)(x-2))(xA​+x+1B​+x−2C​)((x)(x+1)(x−2))
=(A+B+C)x2−(A+2B−C)x−2A=(A+B+C)x^2-(A+2B-C)x-2A=(A+B+C)x2−(A+2B−C)x−2A
(3x2+6x−2x3−x2−2x)((x)(x+1)(x−2))(\frac{3x^2+6x-2}{x^3-x^2-2x})((x)(x+1)(x-2))(x3−x2−2x3x2+6x−2​)((x)(x+1)(x−2))
=(3)x2+(6)x−(2)=(3)x^2+(6)x-(2)=(3)x2+(6)x−(2)

As you can see, the two sides of the equation can be grouped by the coefficients of x2x^2x2, x1x^1x1, and x0x^0x0.

  • Solve for the coefficients of x2x^2x2, x1x^1x1, and x0x^0x0 on both sides of the equation
    • Equate coefficients of x2x^2x2: A+B+C=3A+B+C=3A+B+C=3
    • Equate coefficients of x1x^1x1: −A−2B+C=7-A-2B+C=7−A−2B+C=7
    • Equate coefficients of x0x^0x0: −2A=−2-2A=-2−2A=−2
  • We can use the coefficients to find the values of AAA, BBB, and CCC (e.g. A=1A=1A=1)
    f(x)=Ax+Bx+1+Cx−2f(x)=\frac{A}{x}+\frac{B}{x+1}+\frac{C}{x-2}f(x)=xA​+x+1B​+x−2C​
    =1x−2x+1+4x−2=\frac{1}{x}-\frac{2}{x+1}+\frac{4}{x-2}=x1​−x+12​+x−24​

Now that we know f(x)f(x)f(x), we can integrate it more easily.

∫3x2+7x−2x3−x2−2x dx=∫(1x−2x+1+4x−2) dx\int{\frac{3x^2+7x-2}{x^3-x^2-2x}}\,dx=\int{(\frac{1}{x}-\frac{2}{x+1}+\frac{4}{x-2})\,dx}∫x3−x2−2x3x2+7x−2​dx=∫(x1​−x+12​+x−24​)dx
=ln⁡∣x∣(x−2)4(x+1)2+C=\ln\frac{|x|(x-2)^4}{(x+1)^2}+C=ln(x+1)2∣x∣(x−2)4​+C
